text.tspan: Make your own rules:
e.g. a "once a day/week rule", changing from larger to smaller
quantities... And take the pressure off: every reduction is
great!
If you eat meat,
then it should be organic and from species-
appropriate, regional production, preferably from the direct
marketer. Find out whether there are suppliers of organic
meat in your region. Make sure the animal feed is not coming
from overseas. And you just learned which animals cause the
least CO2 equivalents!
If you fear protein deficiency
by eating less meat, don ÃÅt
worry! You can still follow a healthy, balanced diet:
Legumes, cereals and dairy products are high-quality sources
of protein.
If you miss the taste of meat,
you are well served with
strongly spiced dishes like curries. Also "as if" versions, for
example noodles with soy Bolognese sauce or sliced meat with
seitan, are a good alternative for some people.
Others, e.g. celebrity chef Jamie Oliver prefer to cook without
trying to replace meat - because meat alternatives such as tofu
etc. are often not well received by meat eaters.
